Merge branch 'fix-add-movies' into dev

On upgrade ensure new movies are added for trakt and Cloud.

- For trakt: reset last watched activity timestamp, will trigger movie
  lists sync.
- For Cloud: reset sync state completely, triggering a full data merge.
MovieTools: add new movies even if loop ends prematurely (error, offline).

CREDITS: update links, add some missing libraries.

Closes #669.
Also drop DashClock library dependency.

Merge pull request #659 from UweTrottmann/movies-more-region-usage

Movies more region usage

MovieDetailsFragment: switch to movie localization dialog, incl. region.

Now that the selected region influences the release date shown, use the
language dialog used for discover, which includes selection of region.
MovieLocalizationDialogFragment: note changed event behavior.

MovieTools: get (theatrical) release date for region, if available.

This will display the correct date in most cases. It will not if coming
from e.g. disc releases as it always picks the theatrical release first.

Optimization: re-use language and region when updating movies.
Use region for popular movies + search.

Merge branch 'restore-infinite-calendar-option' into dev
Move Extension class to upper level.
ExtensionManager: reduce visibility, guard against programming errors.
ExtensionsConfigurationActivity: note on testing.

ExtensionManager: Initialize on first use instead of app start.

Possibly avoids issues with scheduling extension JobIntentServices if
app start is taking a while causing jobs to fail.

ExtensionPackageChangeReceiver: ignore updates to SeriesGuide itself.

It would schedule JobIntentServices to re-subscribe built-in extensions.
But that may crash as SeriesGuide is no longer running shortly after.

Restore infinite calendar option, default to on.

Using new settings key so existing users will see the infinite calendar
by default.

Merge branch 'fix-calendar-jump-on-restart' into dev

CalendarFragment2: build query async, post result to avoid jumping bug.

For whatever reason RecyclerView jumps to next page if data is delivered
too quickly. Posting the query string value instead of setting it seems
to delay data delivery reliably so the issue no longer occurs.

Using coroutines to build in the background is just a bonus.

Move from JobIntentService to WorkManager using a CoroutineWorker, this

conflicts with full Guava version required by API client. So update to
full Guava 27.x which avoids the duplicate class.

Merge branch 'full-episode-details' into dev

Get full episode details again when adding/updating show. Closes #562.

LAST_UPDATED field is now used to determine when to update an episode,
is set to LAST_EDITED on add/update. This ensures full details get
loaded for those that do not have them, yet (user did not view them).

As a bonus episodes restored from a backup will now get updated, even
if the LAST_EDITED value matches the TVDB value. Because their
LAST_UPDATED value will be the default value.

Merge branch 'list-id-checks' into dev
Add additional empty checks for list and list item ids.
Ensure there is a list id and list item id when importing.

ListWidgetProvider: use one-shot alarm for widget updates.

For a repeating alarm all repeats are batched until the device wakes up
again and then delivered *all* instead of just the latest. Now use a
one-shot alarm and re-schedule it after updating the widgets.
NotificationService: extract pending intent to helper method.
Drop unused notification service job id.
NotificationService: schedule wake-up every minute in debug mode.

ListWidgetProvider: cancel old implicit widget update alarm on upgrade.

Otherwise pre-O devices will have two widget update alarms until
rebooted. The new alarm is automatically scheduled after the APK is
updated as the system triggers onUpdate for all widgets.

ListWidgetProvider: use explicit broadcast to support O+.

- Update alarm still used implicit one, no longer supported on O:
  https://commonsware.com/blog/2017/04/11/android-o-implicit-broadcast-ban.html

ListWidgetProvider: use broadcast to notify about data changes.

Instead of directly calling notifyAppWidgetViewDataChanged() let the
widget broadcast receiver do it.

Regression: use broadcast pending intent for notifications service.

Introduced with `b58e483 NotificationService: convert into
JobIntentService.`. Continued to use a service intent, which worked
with JobIntentService pre-O. On O starting the service failed.
By converting to an AsyncTask notifications broke for everyone,
as NotificationService is no longer a true service.
API 2.0.3: send version if API 2, restore backwards compatibility.

- Stay on 1.7.2 for now, 1.8.0 is too new.

ExtensionPackageChangeReceiver: check for receiver instead of service.

- Fixes updated extensions not getting detected.

Regression: use async task for notifications to work while dozing.

- Introduced with `b58e483 NotificationService: convert into JobIntentService.`
- A job does not run when the device is dozing, so use an AsyncTask
  launched right from the broadcast receiver instead using goAsync().
- Fixes notifications not working on Android 8.x where JobIntentService
  did use jobs.
Use compileSdk 27, build tools 27 to match support lib version.
API 2.0.2: post unsubscribe to avoid concurrent mod of subscribers.

Extensions: Use JobIntentService to process extension actions.

- API 2.0.1: extensions publish actions through broadcasts instead of
  starting the now removed ExtensionSubscriberService.

Ensure add task progress update has correct values.

- Progress update happens on main thread. So for example when adding two shows, the added progress update of the first show may happen after the background add thread has already overwritten current show tvdb id and name. So a progress update would be sent out using incorrect values.
- Pass values for progress update through parameters instead of fields. Ensures progress udpate thread always has correct values.

Fix SwipeRefreshLayout old content overlay when switching between tabs.

- When the NOW tab fragments got destroyed while switching tabs and the refresh indicator was still visible, when restoring the fragment the SwipeRefreshLayout would display a snapshot of the old content as overlay over the actual content. So forcibly destroy the drawing cache and clear any animation if the views are destroyed. Adapted from http://stackoverflow.com/a/27073879

Merge branch 'fix-ellipsis' into beta

Use singleLine instead of maxLines wherever possible.

- Fixes text ellipsis cutting off text or not showing ellipsis character. This is fixed in later versions of Android, but there using maxLines will cut off text on the word level. We want the maximum amount of chars shown instead (which is what singleLine is doing).

Handle DST gap when calculating show and episode release time.

- Move local time forward in hour increments until outside of gap (gap typically is 1 hour). We ignore the current single special case with 30 min DST shift (Australia's Lord Howe Island) as it's unlikely a show will come from there, sorry guys!
Drop more unused TimeTools stuff.

Update show day and time display calculations.

- Drop a bunch of unused TimeTools stuff.
- Ensure week day has a supported value before using it.
Remove redundant comma.

- Store show time zone.

- Update TimeTools tests.
- Still fails midnight test, does not respect user offsets.

Disable movie action buttons on trigger until data reload.

- Make duplicate tasks less likely.

Disable episode action buttons until data reload.

- Make posting duplicate tasks less likely. The (watch, collect, skip) button gets disabled until the loader forces a UI refresh, which re-enables all buttons. The clear disadvantage is that anything forcing a refresh of the same UI parts (e.g. background show update finishes) will re-enable the buttons.

time.
